caption: Definitely enjoyed myself the two waiters Roger and Craig were awesome, besides the fact that the food was great I would definitely go back just because of them.

Atmosphere is nice and service was good. Food was very terrible. We all had steaks and they were tougher than the worst steak cuts I've ever had in my life You would expect nice tender steaks at $56-58 each. Definitely not worth it

I have been to multiple steak house with the same type of price range as Chandler. And I was expecting a great quality meal and service. But my experience here wasnt good. When I tasted them, they were mediocre and the food was oversalted. And the price is way too expensive for the food they are serving. The waitress had a little attitude and also was not properly taking care of our table. I was pouring myself and others in the table waters and I have to call her to take away the finished food because she barely comes back to check on our table. This is truly embarrassing experience especially I had company. I said to the waitress that I did not like this food because it is oversalted food and wasnt taste good. The waitress then called the manager and I said the same thing. The manager asked if I wanted a different dish but honestly after tasting the food I didnt think it was worth ordering or giving them another chance because my overall experience wasn't good and the other food tasted mediocre to me. When I checked my bill, the oversalted food was added to my bill so I have to speak to them about it. Not a pleasant experience. will not come back here.

Went for the third time last night. 2 out 3 steaks had to go back because they were under, while i sat there in front in the kitchen i saw at least 5 more come back as well. For $60 for filets,  you would think they would re-cook the whole meal. No they leave the sides on the table,  take 10 minutes to bring the steaks back, the same ones that were originally cooked, albiet dried out and not very good at that point.  Then our friends pay cash, and the server, never offered them change, keeping a huge tip. The potato puree was bland and lacked flavor of any kind. My steak was good, but not any better than any local steakhouse, and much more expensive. Strike 3.
Gave me food poisoning

FANTASTIC SERVICE! Every staff member at chandler gave the place a comfortable vibe. My server was ISLA and she did a great job. She always got my orders correct and was enthusiastic the whole time. I highly recommend chandler steakhouse for the service and the great food. I love the steak, biggest steak I’ve ever had ever. I will definitely come again with friends.
Enough is enough. It’s time to reopen

My friend and I went and this steak house was absolutely amazing. I was so glad to NOT have a dry aged steak . The steak and chop salad was exquisite. I have been to many steak houses but this ny strip was very tender. Best I have ever had . Please dont change to dry aged.  It was so nice to have a traditional grilled steak that was cooked to perfection . I look forward to my next visit . Thank you

We located to western Massachusetts about 10 years ago from Michigan and in all those years, we have struggled to find a great, juicy cut of steak like we are used to back home. When our 15 year anniversary came up this year, we decided to book a room at MGM and give The Chandler Steakhouse a try. We were very hesitant about trying it because of all of the negative Google reviews, but we took a chance a made a reservation. Let me tell you, they did not disappoint! The service was incredible! On the table, they left us a handwritten note congratulating us on our anniversary and gave us free glasses of sparkling wine. Our server, Craig, was very knowledgable about the menu and attentive to our needs. For starters, we ordered the Lobster Bisque and Mixed Field Greens salad. The Bisque was AMAZING! It might be the best lobster bisque I've ever had. It was creamy, but not overwhelmingly and had actual, fresh chunks of seafood in it (some places puree everything in their bisques). For our meal, we both ordered the 7oz. Tenderloin of Beef, Herb Roasted Mushrooms, and Blistered Asparagus. The steak was also AMAZING! The cut of beef was so smooth and juicy and cooked to perfection. It went down like butter! They brought us a free extra side of au jus to dip it in, but it didn't even really need it. The mushrooms were very good and went nicely with the steak. Our only complaint, and it's minor, is the asparagus was slightly undercooked and we probably wouldn't order that again. The staff at the Chandler went out of their way to make our anniversary special and it was a GREAT dining experience. I can't compliment the steak enough and we are so excited to finally have a great steak place in the area. We can't wait to bring our out-of-town family here when they come for a visit!
Food was off the charts! Our server Laurie was incredibly attentive and helpful.  She helped make our anniversary dinner amazing . Totally recommend this place!

Beautiful restaurant. And thats about it. First girl that came to our table was great then downhill from there. Service was rushed and it wasnt busy. Lobster cake was cold. Had a few apps that were ok. This is MGM's steak house and the steak was far from quality. We had the bone in rib eye. Looked good but was probably the worst steak ive ever had at a restaurant. Was very chewy and dry and it was oscared. Also let the manager know on our way out and it appeared he has heard this before. Bad experience all the way around. Never again

It was good, should have been great!  Service and ambiance were great, the menu was well described and with good selections for a steakhouse. The wine list was great and offered something for everyone.  The meals lacked the finesse that their pricing should demand, my steak was cooked perfectly but the side of fries were undercooked and cold. My wife's scallops were well prepared but cold and her side of asparagus was covered by a layer of grated cheese that totally took away from the flavor.  Here is my problem, at $370 per couple before tip, this should have been an experience and it simply wasn't. The meal was good but could have been had for less than half of that price elsewhere in the other many good restaurants in the area. This was for 2 people with one cocktail each,  a bottle of wine and no dessert.  It was good, should have been great, shame that it wasn't. This area can use a destination restaurant but this isn't it.
Great place to eat love the steak here! Nice and friendly servers!
Will not return. Food was cold and terrible. Wait staff is inattentive. On top of it all, very expensive for the poor quality of the food.
Awful dining experience and the food was extremely plain.  Sorry I went there and do not recommend this place.  Drinks and food are unbelievably expensive and lacks quality.

I must say after reading all the reviews i was leery on trying this place.  I have had a good experience here the last 4 times I've went. Normally sit at the bar or lounge area. I've tried 3 different steaks and they remind me of the other steak places like Capital grill and such. Side prices are a little high and not to great but not horrible. Had the carrot and they were under cooked, Fries are ok but huge helping and the seasoning was gross couldn't finish. Potato puree is hard to eat as it too soupy and runs off everything. Steaks were great and my guest said the Lobster was good. I'll keep coming back for the steak!

Wonderful time and a great place to relax and enjoy a really good meal. The service is wonderful and the food will totally please you. Everything from steak to vegan entrees for your dining delight and be sure to leave a little room for desert, they're are awesome and well worth the time to explore.
Loved it .

Went with my husband for my birthday and for the $230 we should have cooked our own food at home.. staff was rude..I believe because we went in wearing hoodies, Jordan’s and ball caps  and what not looking a little rough on the edges.. our original plans for the night was to just gamble and leave but as my husband tells me I deserve to have whatever I would like to eat for dinner although we was not dressed for the occasion.. as i was still sitting in my seat I asked to use the bathroom and I was escorted out to use the casinos bathroom instead..I wanted to say something but I didn’t want to ruin my birthday vibes.. just because we paid our bill and I asked to use the bathroom didn’t mean we was done with our table..I wanted to sit back down and talk a little longer because I was enjoying and celebrating my birthday.. instead we was escorted out.. NEVER AGAIN

Started with Caesar salad for two $25.00. Not done tableside. When it came, it looked like it came from a diner and it was tasteless. Switched to wedge salad $14.00 each, I had to ask for more bacon and dressing. It was nothing special. I had filet mignon  $46.00, it was good but a real steakhouse can do so much better. Wait time was very long. Waste of our time and money.

We sat at the bar for a low key dinner on a late Saturday night. Thankfully, this restaurant was the only redeeming thing at this MGM property. Food was fantastic, bartenders were as skilled as they were friendly. Don’t come to the MGM to stay in the hotel, but if you happen to be here I’d definitely recommend this place for a quality dinner or casual cocktails.

I love good food and will spend on it. However, here is way over priced. Spent 58 dollars on steak and 4 dollars on water. Everything else was 10 or 21 dollars extra charge. Between two people it came to 200 not worth it.
Food was great, Service was amazing best steak house in Springfield
Amazing food, had to wait 30 mins for a table despite having a reservation

First time visiting before Aerosmith concert. On a positive note my glass of wine was good. Decent lobster appetizer. Unfortunately the rest of the meal did not match the ambiance of the restaurant and the attentive service we received. Our Caesar salad was bland, the sautéed spinach side was way too salty, and one would have thought my veal parm entree l was reheated from the day before. Very disappointed but would have been upset if this had been a “special” occasion meal.
Prime rib dry Not worth the money In Springfield best place 350 grill That was first choice but they where closed on monday

My son and I had a wonderful birthday dinner. We were warmly welcomed by the hostesses, the wait staff and others. The steaks were lightly seasoned and cooked to a perfect medium rare. He had the truffle macaroni and cheese and I had the wild mushrooms and a baked potato for side dishes. the portions were extremely generous and we both had enough for lunch for the next day. I was also very impressed with the staff because I was looking for a certain type of wine and when I shared that I couldn't find on their list they double checked and found something that was even better than I expected. we had such a wonderful time that I am sending my oldest daughter there with her husband for their first anniversary in October.

This was our 1st time dining at Chandler and we were less than impressed with the service experience (especially considering the cost of our meals) the food was great but our server was mediocre at best there were times when we wondered if he just forgot about us.
Good place if you got expensive taste. Fine dining at its best

Horrible meal at MGM Last Night... We've been there several times for a nice dinner. They substituted their $56 dollar 20 OZ DRY AGED RIB EYE with a 7 dollar steak from Big Y and now charge $58 for it. From the point that the waitress showed up at our table one issue after another. The manager came by to tell me the reason my steak sucked and was well done was that I didn't ask for a center cut. Unbeknownst to me there is a secret code you need to tell the cook if you want a mediocre steak for 58 dollars. The Place was awesome when it first opened and we were thrilled to have a nice place to go. Complete waste of $260 dollars, but never again, go to Northampton or West Hartford.
Overpriced for the quality.
great food and the steaks we're cooked to my liking must try it

First time here and I sat at the bar. Fast service for a Friday night, bartender was Veronica and she was really friendly. They use cold brew espresso in their espresso martini and the food was excellent. Will come here again in the future for sure. 🍍
Great atmosphere, great service and amazing food!
Great food.  My favorite is the chandler burger,  the Caesar,  and the brick chicken.  Drinks are great too!
The Chandler Steakhouse at MGM Springfield...Great place with delicious food...ordered the burger and fries ..staff was excellent ..
Way over priced.  Food was horrible and service very slow. Would not recommend this restaurant.
Theresa was wonderful. Excellent service overall. Thank you
Wonderful place. Wonderful staff. Great food and atmosphere.

Please don't waste your money on the lamb. Let me save you 50 dollars. It was tough stringy and wasn't even cooked right. The prime rib turned out great but two of us wasted 50$ on the lamb. Didn't even finish it, it was so bad. Couldn't even give the left overs to the dog it was so fatty and chewy. The shrimp was great tho and so was our waitress. Those cooks dont know what their doing though. Must be paying them 15$ an hour. I can get better lamb for 10$ at my shop rite. Please dont make the same mistake I did
Food was great, just make sure you bring some good money to spend but worth it. Fine dining at its best
Very classy. Great place for special family dinners.
Great service & Food😋
overpriced for the quality of food you expected at the steakhouse, service is great.

Don't waste your money. The food is way overpriced compared to the quality. Everything we ate seemed to be overly salty from the French onion soup to the carrots. The au gratin potatoes were paste like and ruined by the addition of nutmeg. The garlic shrimp way too rich and the sauce drowned out the shrimp. Steak mediocre. Trying to be high class in lower class neighborhood just does not work.

O.M.G the best ever ..whant food from the Gods ..u come here ..a little pricey but whorth every penny ..u must come and experience a royal treatment from the staff.. Best experience ever .. Defenetly looking forward to another amazing meal..
After a couple bad visits at first, they've finally hit their stride. Worth going to, finally!
Quite possibly the best steak I have ever tasted!

Where do I begin...  Sadly, this place will not last without an overhaul.  The good: atmosphere is fantastic. Plush and elegant, comfortable seating. Sal, our waiter, was the lone bright spot of the rest of the experience.  The bad: first off, they lie to you and tell you the steak is "dry aged". If by dry aged they mean they aged it for one day in the fridge, I guess I would believe that. For $54, I completely wasted my money. Ordered medium rare, like any good NY Strip should be. First steak came out was a gray .5" high steak that looked like it came from the local grocery store. Well done - sent it back. Replacement came back looking like a true NY strip, and was underdone, basically rare. At this point I'm starving so I decide to just keep it. No seasoning to speak of, I had to empty the salt and pepper shaker onto the steak to give it any flavor. Chews like shoe leather.  The "add-on" special was described as scallops in a cheesey cream sauce. Perfect compliment for my steak, I think. Nope. Two dry scallops came clumsily sitting atop the steak. For $18 dollars I got a couple scallops. No thanks.  $300 for a 2 person dinner that mostly sucked. I'm getting annoyed just thinking about it, so I'll stop there.  Save your money and eat elsewhere.

Dined here for the first time a few nights ago and I was extremely impressed! Tebanis recommended me the best dishes and drinks, which were amazing, and went above and beyond to make sure my night was special. Totally exceeded my expectations. I will definitely be back again soon!

Great food, but very expensive. Expect to spend at least $100 per person. Try to get a booth if possible - their seats are red velvet and are aesthetically pleasing. This was the first time that a restaurant's servers came to check up on us a bit too much and interrupted the conversation some. No biggie, just a small hiccup that night. They were spot-on with the refills though.
Absolutely horrible, steak was dry, sides were just a name. Beyond overpriced. I wouldn’t expect this restaurant to last.
i have been here multiple times and the food is always excellent. they just cant get the service part of it right.

Great selection of Finer Foods. Dishes ranging from Japanese Miyazaki to Virgin Lamb. An Exquisite collection of Drinks. A must visit for the Distinguished tongue. An overall Delightfully Premium Experience!
Wonderful atmosphere, staff was courteous and professional. The food and presentation was fabulous!

We dined her tonight after the comedy show and everthing was great! When we walked in the hostess was accommodating and very sweet. Arlene and her partner were really beyond great!! They both treated all of us like VIPs and were extremely knowledgeable about the food and drinks. Everything was just perfect!  I read the other reviews and your not only paying for the food you're also paying for the service, atmosphere, the whole experience. If your afraid to spend money go somewhere you can afford.  The food and drinks were fantastic along with the presentations and creativity.  The four of us had a great time with great food and perfect service! Thanks Arlene and staff!!
Grossly overpriced. The food was tasty, but not worth the cost. I will most likely not return.

For the price of what we paid, was very disappointed in the steak. Dry aged meat should eat like butter. They must have killed the cow just before we got there. Very very very disappointed. Staff was on point and good to deal with. But food was a different story.
the food was alright but it was too expensive for what is was
Laurie, our waitress was a delight.   She was extremely helpful and made our dinner special.  Really good food, a little pricey,  but the portions are generous enough to split.

I love a good steak and have eaten at so many high end steak restaurants.  My girlfriend and I wanted to check out the new casino and even though Chandlers had bad reviews we tried it.  Believe the reviews, avoid this place!  Could be the worst steaks we ever had.  Buy a steak from Stop n Shop, put it in your fridge for two weeks, overcook it and taste, that's Chandlers.  Service was average, had to ask twice for a drink.  We sent one steak back and didn't replace it so for 1 steak that was bad, 2 drinks, a salad and mushrooms it was $115 wasted.

Visited this so described Fine Dinning Restaurant and quickly realized how awful and how overrated it was. Food was horrible and I mean ridiculously horrible. Dinner with tip was $300 for 2 people. Sal the waiter earned his 20% but the kitchen and its chef should be cooking at a chain buffet. Do not waste your time or your money. Outback is far less and 10x better. Waygu Beef $85 was a joke and tasted like cooked lard. #beware #nogood #notworth

Ambiance 10. Food 3-5.  Naked plates of beef should be served with sides. Dont care if its a dollop of mashed potatoes and 1 piece of asparagus. You need to compensate for average cuts of meat.  Salt shaker on table not the sprinkling that a spoon provides. The charred brussel sprouts were indeed charred masking the flavor of the vegetable.

Worst experience ever!!!!  The food was horrible horrible horrible to say the least and the service was worse!!!  Our waitress was clearing our table of food and drinks before we were anywhere near done and even put her hand ontop of my wedge salad while I was eating to ask me if I was finished!!!  I thought it had to be a joke!  She then took a large amount of money off the table assuming it was tip.  This restaurant put a nice dress on a waitress all jacked up with tattoos on the floor without a lick of experience, training, or class.  A total failure for management!  Never again.

Our first time at The Chandler was, without a doubt, the best dining experience we have had ever. Everyone was so very pleasant!!  Our waiter, Jason, was excellent as well as the other servers also.  The food was done to perfection.  We will definitely make a return there the next time we're in Springfield.

Well just because you win big at the casino doesn't mean your entitled to eat at a good restaurant there. We should of went to Maxes.  1)Waitress grabbed my girlfriend's salad with her hands are said are you done with that. 2) My steak for $60 sucked. I don't not consider this expensive. 3) She removed our drinking water from the table before we were done. 4) she took a $40 cash tip and just walked away when we were sitting there. Food was bland. Overpriced for MGM disappointed...
nice vibe.. but slow service and food nothing special but pricey

We were seated at 9:15pm and given drink and dinner menus right away. That was the full extent of any semblance of service and food quality that you could expect to find outside of a Chili’s. The drinks took forever to come and another 20 minutes went by before we had bread. We ordered the oysters which were the most affordable and best tasting food we had tonight-those took 30 minutes to arrive. They finally took our order and it took 90 minutes to come out of the kitchen. A VIP party in one of the private rooms had the attention of every manager and server in the whole place and anyone outside of that room was lucky to get a second glance. The scallops and prime rib were average at best. The ribeye was Sizzler quality and cold-not remotely worthy of the $58.00 ala carte price tag. The king crab leg at $38.00 as an addition to the steak was over cooked, cold and rubbery. It came with a cracker but it was so over cooked the cracker was useless as the shell would bend in any direction you tried to crack it. They were eventually sent back-something I think I’ve done only one or two other times in my entire life. The music was too loud inside the restaurant and the ambiance was wanting at best. Most of the staff seemed surprisingly unfriendly and hurried. The entire experience was not worth $40.00 let alone $400.00. I will not be returning to this restaurant ever-even if there was a statewide famine and it was the only place with food. If you are looking for a great date night or a place to celebrate a special occasion I would completely steer clear of Chandler Steakhouse. It fell so short of the amazing things I’ve come to expect from MGM properties in Las Vegas that I could hardly believe my eyes or my taste buds. I half expected the Bar Rescue guy to come storming through the door, kick us all out and have a heart to heart with management and staff but we just weren’t that lucky. I gave this place 1 star because it wasn’t possible to give zero.

Visited on 11/17.  Staff was great and service was excellent.  Drink prices very high $16 for Martini and was a very short pour martini.  Basic Beer $6.  Food was ok but very expensive.  Ala Cart sides are $12 for fries, baked potato etc.  Atmosphere nice but too pricey for Springfield area.

This was first time at this restaurant at the MGM; after losing our money quickly at the casino. We were greeted at the door and the staff was pleasant. I went with a steak, of course, and ordered a few sides. The food was expensive, but worth it. The steak was superb.  To be honest, it had to have been the best steak I have had in a while. The sides were pricey, but again, worth every penny. The way I see it is, I am in a casino, food will be expensive.  I highly recommend if you are in the area or looking for a great meal and don't care about price.

Not great.  The atmosphere is nice, wait staff was friendly, but I can see why the restaurant was relatively empty on a Saturday night.  After we sat down we waited 15 minutes before we were approached with menus.  Food took quite a while to come out and everything was generally slow.  Steaks were okay, 2 were overdone to the point that they had a burnt crust on the outside, and 1 was okay, but definitely not worth $58 for a ribeye, I've had way better elsewhere for a lot less money.  A la carte sides can be fine, but $12 for a plain baked potato? in Springfield!?  Doesn't seem sustainable.  I won't be going back, unfortunately.  For big city prices you expect big city service and better quality food.

It was a very nice restaurant and all the staff we spoke to were very polite and nice.  Our waitress Theresa was Awesome, she was very friendly, professional and always greeted us with a smile.  The food was amazing!  The baked potatoe was about 8 inches long!  I have never seen them that big!  LOL.  I prdered the prime rib and it melted in my mouth!  I highly recommend Chandlers at the MGM!
Great food, Salvatore was excellent and very personable and professional. Will definitely be back
The food was amazing and our server Salvatore was entertaining,  knowledgeable,  and friendly.  Would highly recommend a trip and be sure to ask for him when you visit.  He is truly a gem!
Amazing food and experience !!!! A Springfield must made perfect by Salvatore 😁😁😁
Great food! Salvatore made the experience amazing!  Would definitely come back!
Nice place with good food. Service could be better.

I don't want to come off as pretentious, just offering my feedback.  My father is a chef in New York, I've trained under him and worked in a kitchen, though I have not been to culinary school. I would not call myself a chef because of never attending culinary school, but I do have a lot of culinary knowledge and am exceptional when it comes to making steaks, lamb chops, and other meals.  I came here to take my wife out for her birthday, and was very impressed with the atmosphere of this place. I knew the prices would be high so I expected a lot out of this place, considering there are amazing places in New York that are cheaper. We waited about 15 minutes for our server to come back and take our order, perhaps it felt so long because we already knew what we wanted to order, but the wait was a mild damper on the night.  We ordered the dry aged ribeye steak, lamb chops, both medium rare and the prime rib. It took about 40 minutes for the food to arrive and this was the most disappointing part of the night.  The rib eye's crust was hard and burnt, taking away a lot of the taste from the steak. I also couldn't taste a difference in aging until I got to the skin around the bone. There also seemed to be a lack of seasoning, and we had to ask for salt and pepper. Besides this the steak was okay in terms of juiciness but the burnt outside really hurt the taste.  The prime rib reminded me a lot of a cold cut roast beef. The horseradish sauce was delicious but the meat seemed to also lack seasoning.  The lamb chops were delicious, though the chefs did not render the fat. I personally believe the fat coupled with the meat is the best part of a lamb chop, but this fat was slightly gooey from not being rendered properly.  The manager was the one who took our food orders, I asked if there was anything special he could do as it was my wife's birthday. He said he would surprise us, but never came to our table again.  With these 3 plates and 2 drinks, I spent about $202 and left very upset as I could have gotten a $13 steak from stop and shop which would have tasted better. I am giving this place 2 stars for ambience, but I believe the chefs need a bit more training before these prices are even remotely justifiable.

We’ve been to better steakhouses without the oomph of being in an MGM casino. Nice atmosphere and staff, but sub-par food and menu. We got the ribeye and salmon. They  were bland and too plain for our taste. No seasoning or sauces at all. We ordered a side of mushrooms and fries. The mushrooms were cold and hardly cooked, and the fries were just plain fries. No parmesaean, oil, seasoning, or anything. I would expect more with the prices they charge.

Had a splendid dinner here at The Chandler @MGM Springfield.. we celebrated my Parents' birthday weekend with a lovely and delicious dinner and our Waitress Laurie was more than pleasant and accommodating.. they even had  a personalized birthday card signed by all staff and and a complimentary dessert.. Best restaurant and best service in the MGM Springfield.. Again kudos to Laurie for exemplary service and attentiveness..

Amazing food, great vibe, cool drinks that come in smokey boxes and our waitress was some of the best service I have ever received. Laurie was our waitress and she was phenomenal. Thanks for keeping us laughing and staying on top of everything. Great evening spent!!!

Had a great meal at The Chandler this Evening. We were served by Salvatore and he was EXCELLENT! Very attentive and friendly. He made a delicious Ceasar Salad for us table side. I ordered the 20 oz Rib Eye and I can honestly say one of the tastiest steaks I ever had. No room for dessert. Enjoyed a couple of nice cocktails with the meal. The ambiance was aligned with other great steak houses. The circular booths are comfortable. Without question we will return. Thanks again Salvatore!

WOW! We loved the Chandler restaurant! Six of us were celebrating one’s birthday.  The decor reminded me of old world charm/ the rat pack era with its red velvet banquettes and beautiful chandelier above. The music fit the decor perfectly.  The food was 100%. Everyone loved everything they ordered.  Our server, Theresa treated  us like royalty. she was at our beck and call at all times. She explained how  Lobster Thermidor was prepared , as well as the mushrooms which everyone loved. She also suggested the steak tartare which most of us had not  ever had before and loved it ! and  she made recommendations for a delicious red wine. She also prepared our Caesar salad table-side.  There was a lot of food  being ordered for six people including appetizers entrées , dessert and drinks and it all went so smoothly! We felt like the only people there yet the place was crowded . I think we were the last diners to leave that evening  and I can’t wait to return!
Great dinner steaks all around. Our waiter Salvatore was awesome and very attentive and personable with class..
The atmosphere was great. The food, not so much.

Sounds like they got off to a 50/50 challenging start. Most restaurants do. I'll bet that they grow into an excellent fine dining experience. We are thinking of meeting there for dinner this coming Tuesday as I'm coming up from Hartford and my wife is on her way to Boston.

I know there are many bad reviews and we reviewed them all but made the decision to try it out anyway. Im only giving it 4 stars because we waited 15 min after being seated before being asked if we wanted a drink or giving us menus. We made a reservation and was seated before our time so we believe that might be why.  We got steaks. Prime rib and sirloin. Potatoe purée and Caesar salads and some really yummy wine. Overall the staff was quite professional.  The bread was a mini pull apart loaf that was slathered in butter and also served with butter. It was soft and fresh and delicious.  The salad came on a cart where it was made fresh in front of us where we decided the contents. The dressing was mixed tableside into the salad which made the salad very fresh. The croutons were a bit large but tasty. They had fresh peppercorn ready to top off the salads.  The prime rib came tableside in the form of a roast where you picked your cut and we’re served on the spot. It was served with creamy horseradish sauce in a mini serving boat and we were asked if we wanted fresh horseradish grated on top which we endulged. The prime rib was roughly 1.5 lbs and it wasn’t a steak one could finish at one sitting. Even though I shared it there was enough to take home for another meal. The 8 oz sirloin was cooked to perfection and perfectly sized to finish at mealtime.  The manager came to the table. Wanted input on our meal and seemed very genuine about what our opinion was.  In the end the prices were spot on for a high end steakhouse. If you are expecting outback prices don’t dine here. The steak at The Chandler is on a very different level and well worth the try.

We had a very nice birthday experience. The staff even prepared and signed a birthday card. Food was expensive, but tasty. Do not go for dinner unless you're prepared to spend roughly $75 per person, including drinks, app and dinner. Wait staff was attentive and made sure to promptly refill drinks. The best dirty martini I've ever tasted, no exaggeration. Food was cooked properly and they even cut my prime rib right in front of me! A la carte sides. Carrots were a little undercooked but still edible. Would go back for another special occasion. Thank you!

Had the pleasure of finally going here for a night out and must say Ilana was one of the best up beat most polite individuals I have ever served me. You need many more just like her. She keeps a smile on her face as well as the customers. Keep it up I will sure be back
The Chandler is a definite go to! The Bartenders are phenomenal! My bartender Was Ilana and her attention to the patrons was above and beyond! A definite A+!

I was there for happy hour and dinner  the week after the restaurant opened and had the pleasure of having Ilana as our bartender. The food was fabulous and the service from Ilana was exemplary!   She was both knowledgeable about the interesting libations and was able to handle everything (including a new restaurant opening) with ease.  I highly recommend the restaurant and especially the bar which includes innovative cocktails and a nice tavern menu!

Nice wait staff but horrible over priced food. My salmon came out pretty much raw sent it back n they precooked the same piece n only sent back half of it n the manager had nothing to say about it n still charged us the full $35 for the piece of salmon n it still was not cooked all the way.  I will never go back again
Don’t bother unless you are spending your winnings or need to get away from the sweat pants crowd.

Horrible service, ok food. I expect better for the price. Long wait at an off peak time with no one dining. We were told 20 minutes, after 20 minutes we were told another 10 minutes. After we ordered we didnt see our waitress again.
We went to Chandlers, and the food was delicious! It was a great experience and our server, Jason, was phenomenal. It’s a classy place with classy staff. We will definitely come back again!

When you charge $60 for a steak you are held to certain standards.  Maybe it was because the place is new...but really no excuse when I can cook a $20 ribeye and do better.  The $11 cesar salad was a joke, croutons like rocks.  I went on a Thursday night, party of 1, place was dead... still took over an hour to get my steak.  I was not alone....people at the bar were also disappointed.  Place looks nice, staff is friendly. But dont waste your money.

The food was horrible! It tasted as if the lid on the salt shaker fell off and they dumped every piece of salt Onto my crab cake. My wife had the sole and felt the same way. My beef was not bad nor good about the quality I expect from a chain restaurant like chili’s. We waited entirely to long for everything to include water and menus. Our drinks were always empty and we went on a Wednesday night, they were not busy and had an abundance of staff. The only nice thing I can say is that the hostesses were very friendly.

I was greatly looking forward to going here... Well let me tell you I will never go back. You pay $54 for a sirloin on a plate... That's it. Yes I know its al carte but that doesn't mean you don't season the meat... So if you like paying $54 for a unseasoned steak on a plate hop off the roulette table and run in
